raw_comment:
1. What do you notice?
 
I notice that the proportion of players of color is much higher than the proportion of head coaches of color in every major league sport depicted in the graph. I also notice that players of color make up the majority of all players in every major league sport except for baseball. Conversely, head coaches of color make up less than half of all head coaches in every major league sport. 
 
2. What do you wonder?
 
I wonder why this pattern emerges. Why do people of color make up large proportions of major league sports teams, but not large proportions of coaching staff? Are there any specific roadblocks in place that prevent people of color from assuming coaching positions in major league sports?
 
3. What impact does this have on you and your community?
 
	This affects my community because if racial biases are ingrained in major league sports industries, it may be difficult for people of color in my community to become professional coaches if that is something they aspire to do. 
 
4. What’s going on in this graph? Write a catchy headline that captures the graph’s main idea.
 
This graph shows the discrepancy between the proportion of players of color and the proportion of head coaches of color in major league sports. 
Headline: “The end of the rainbow: Are people of color being prevented from becoming head coaches in major league sports?”
